identificationModule.briefTitle: Evaluation of Acute Post-thrombectomy Complications for Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Evaluation of Acute Post-thrombectomy Complications for Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Retrospective study to assess the incidence of acute complications after thrombectomy for stoke.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Research in the computerized medical file of patients admitted to intensive care unit (ICU) in the last 5 years for a stroke.

Searching for acute complications during the ICU stay. Looking for hemorrhagic, acute renal failure, hemodynamic support, neurologic degradation.

interventions.name: Thrombectomy for stroke
interventions.description: Patients who have had thrombectomy for acute stroke.

primaryOutcomes.description: hemorrhagic complication base on CT scan at day 1
Neurological evaluation based on Glasgow coma scale (from 3 pejorative to 15/15 good)
Evaluation based on biological analyses : creatinine value based on daily routine blood analysis (in mg/dL).

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* \>18 year old
* ICU admitted patient for stroke and received thrombectomy

Exclusion Criteria:

* missing data
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Retrospective cohort based on a computer medical record.

overallOfficials.name: Pierre Goffin, MD, MSc
overallOfficials.affiliation: MontLegia Hospital, Groupe Santé CHC, Liège, Belgium

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: There is not a plan to make IPD available.
